Detailed Description

Contains functions for data visualization.

Function Documentation

static int fifo_open (  )  [static]

Open a fifo (created by the drawdaemon) and start writing to it.

static int fifo_write ( const void *  ptr,
size_t  size,
size_t  nmemb,
FILE *  fp 
) [inline, static]

Write data to the fifo.

Handle exceptions.

Parameters:
ptr Pointer to the data
size Size of each element
nmemb Number of elements
fp Pointer to the File

void plot_coord ( char *  fig,
long  npts,
const double *  ptsx,
const double *  ptsy,
const int32_t *  style,
const double *  limit,
int  ncir,
double(*)  pcir[4],
const char *  title,
const char *  xlabel,
const char *  ylabel,
const char *  format,
  ... 
)

Plot the coordinates ptsx, ptsy using style, and optionally plot ncir circles.

Parameters:
fig Category of the figure
npts Number of points to plot
ptsx x coord of points
ptsy y coord of points
style Style of each point
limit x min, xmax, ymin and ymax
ncir Number of circles
pcir Data for the circles: x, y origin, radius, and color
title title of the plot
xlabel x axis label
ylabel y axis label
format subcategory of the plot.

void imagesc ( char *  fig,
long  nx,
long  ny,
const double *  limit,
const double *  zlim,
const void *  p,
const char *  title,
const char *  xlabel,
const char *  ylabel,
const char *  format,
  ... 
)

Draw an image.

Parameters:
fig Category of the figure
nx the image is of size nx*ny
ny the image is of size nx*ny
limit x min, xmax, ymin and ymax
zlim max, min, the data
p The image
title title of the plot
xlabel x axis label
ylabel y axis label
format subcategory of the plot.
